page.title: 15A TYPICAL DAY IN ETTRICK.
page.content: A shepherd's job has to change with all the seasons. The shepherd gets up at 7.00 has his breakfast and is ready to go out of the house at 7.30. He goes round the hill to check that no sheep are lambing with difficulty. He has feeding bins out on the hills. He feeds them because there isn't enough grass to feed them on and to make milk to feed the lambs with. After he has done all that he goes round the lambing fields and feeds sheep there.After dinner he goes to the nearby sheep and does a final check that no sheep are lambing.He has his afternoon tea and goes further up the hill to do a final check until the morning this is the busiest time of the year.
